title: How to Make Madeleines

steps.headline: Melt the butter, and allow it to cool.
Whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt until well blended.
Beat the eggs and sugar (with an electric mixer, if possible) until the volume of the mixture has tripled and forms a ribbon when the beaters are lifted (about five minutes or so).
Mix in the vanilla extract and beat to combine.
Sift a small amount of the flour mixture into the egg mixture.
steps.description: Using a rubber spatula, fold it in to lighten it. Repeat until all the flour mixture is folded in. Do not overmix! The batter will deflate.

steps.headline: Whisk together a small amount of the flour mixture and the melted butter.
Fold the cooled melted butter into the egg mixture in three additions.
Cover and refrigerate the mixture until slightly firm.
Butter the pans generously.
steps.description: Dust with flour and tap to remove any excess.

steps.headline: Drop a teaspoonful of batter into the center of each mold, making sure the batter remains mounded in the center.
Bake on a center rack for 11-13 minutes, until edges are golden-brown and centers spring back lightly when touched.
Gently remove the madeleines from the pans by tapping them.
steps.description: Let cool on a wire rack smooth sides down.
